Sample.Title: Control HTS cell (replicate 1) [HTS_ctrl-1_S1_L001]

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cell culture protocol was published earlier (Saha et al. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2020 Jul 28;117(30):17864-17875. doi: 10.1073/pnas.2002449117)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: For RNA extraction we used Qiagen RNeasy Kit (Catalog#74104) following manufacturer's protocol. For each experimental conditions, 1 million cells were used to isolate total RNA. For sequencing, libraries were prepared using the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit (Clontech) designed for transcriptome analysis from samples as small as a single cell. For library preparation, the mRNA fraction was enriched, fragmented, sized, reverse transcribed into cDNA and ligated with the appropriate adaptors. Finally, deep sequencing was performed using the Illumine NovaSeq 6000 sequencing system at the University of Kansas Genome Sequencing Facility to generate pair-end reads with read length 101 bp.

Sample.Data-Processing: Illumina bcl2fastq2 conversion software used for basecalling. reads were aligned using the subread-2.0.3 count values containg file were obtained using featureCounts of subread-2.0.3 differential expression was obtained using DESeq2 mean insert length and standdard deviation calculated using picard 2.26.6 Genome_build: UCSC hg38(iGenomes illumina) Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files of raw count values for each Sample

Series.Title: RNA-Seq analysis in human trophoblast stem cells (CT27) upon depletion of Hippo signaling Component TAZ (WWTR1)
Series.Summary: The hippo signaling cofactor TAZ (Also known as WWTR1) regulates expression of genes upon interaction with TEAD transcription factors. Among the TEAD transcription factors, TEAD4 is implicated in regulation of the self-renewal process of human trophoblast stem cells. However, we have a poor understanding about the contribution of TAZ, a co-factor of TEAD4, in that process. Thus, the goal of this study is to define the importance of TAZ in orchestrating global gene expression program in human trophoblast stem cells. Using a RNA interference strategy (RNAi), we depleted TAZ expression in human trophoblast stem cells and compared global gene expression patterns via RNA sequencing (RNA-seq). Three individual experiments were performed. The submitted files contain the data (raw fastq files, count data and deseq2 output) from those experiments.
Series.Overall-Design: TAZ expression was depleted in CT27 human TSC lines via RNA interference using shRNA. Global gene expressions were monitored by culturing control and TAZ-depleted cells in stem state culture condition.
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
